intro: Acinodendron longicaudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Acinodendron longicaudatum is often found in dry, scrubland habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
